title.justification: This is the title of the paper provided by the user.

extractions.description: This paper proposes a new family of neural network specifications known as neural representation as specification. It introduces neural activation patterns (NAPs) that leverage the intrinsic properties of neural networks to define correctness and robustness. The paper presents methods for mining dominant NAPs and demonstrates their effectiveness using formal verification and experimental evaluations.

type.justification: The paper conducts empirical evaluations and experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed specifications using datasets and neural networks.
type.quote: We conduct thorough experimental evaluations from both statistical and formal verification perspectives.

name.justification: The paper focuses on verifying the properties of neural networks, specifically addressing the challenge of creating reliable specifications using neural activation patterns.
name.quote: This unique advantage of using NAPs as specification is enabled by the intrinsic information (or neural representation) embedded in the neural network model.

name.justification: One of the focal points of the paper is verifying the robustness of neural networks against adversarial attacks using NAPs.
name.quote: We show that by using NAP, we can verify the prediction of the entire input space, while still recalling 84% of the data.

name.justification: The paper leverages formal verification methods to ensure the correctness and robustness of neural network predictions.
name.quote: Having a formal specification — a precise, mathematical statement of what AI system is supposed to do is critical for formal verification.

name.justification: The paper uses a 4-layer fully connected feed-forward neural network for its experiments on the MNIST dataset.
name.quote: Both experiments use the MNIST dataset and a 4-layers fully connected network used in VNNCOMP (2021), with 256 neurons for each layer.

is_contributed.justification: The model used in the experiments is not a contribution of this paper; it is based on existing architectures.
is_contributed.quote: a 4-layers fully connected network used in VNNCOMP (2021)

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the experiments in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We show that by using NAP, we can verify the prediction of the entire input space, while still recalling 84% of the data.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not focus on comparing different models numerically but rather on the verification process using NAPs.
is_compared.quote: We show that by using NAP, we can verify the prediction of the entire input space, while still recalling 84% of the data.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for the model's architecture is the VNNCOMP 2021 competition.

name.justification: The dataset used for experiments in the paper.
name.quote: Both experiments use the MNIST dataset and a 4-layers fully connected network used in VNNCOMP (2021), with 256 neurons for each layer.

referenced_paper_title.value: Yann LeCun, Corinna Cortes, and Christopher J. C. Burges. The MNIST database of handwritten digits, 1998.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is well-known and commonly referenced in literature.
referenced_paper_title.quote: the MNIST database of handwritten digits

name.justification: Marabou is explicitly used in the paper for verifying neural network properties.
name.quote: We show that NAPs can be easily checked by out-of-the-box neural network verification tools used in VNNCOMP (2021) – the latest neural network verification competition, such as Marabou.

referenced_paper_title.value: Guy Katz, Derek A. Huang, Duligur Ibeling, Kyle Julian, Christopher Lazarus, Rachel Lim, Parth Shah, Shantanu Thakoor, Haoze Wu, Aleksandar Zeljic, David L. Dill, Mykel J. Kochenderfer, and Clark W. Barrett. The marabou framework for verification and analysis of deep neural networks. In CAV (1), volume 11561 of Lecture Notes in Computer Science, pp. 443–452. Springer, 2019.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for the library is provided in the paper.
